item.title: Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7 Release Date & All Content, Explained
item.content:encoded:
The Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7 release date carries on Epic’s new mission to let everyone relive the early years by experiencing older content again from top to bottom. Key content for Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7 has been revealed, showing you what you can look forward to for several weeks.

Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7 celebrates the battle royale’s Christmas period from SEVEN years ago. The game has changed dramatically over the last seven years, and while Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1 begins the next significant milestone in the game’s history, it’s time for a Holiday throwback.

OG Chapter 1 Season 7 brings back some banging skins and some beloved POIs and weapons.

When Is Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7 Coming Out?

Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7 releases on December 11, exactly two weeks out from Christmas Day!

It’s time to put in some real work. Alongside Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1 is OG Chapter 1 Season 7. It’s a testament to Epic to keep so many areas of the game in operation at once. But the nostalgic return to bygone Fortnite eras has been a huge dub in the community.

The OG Chapter 1 Season 7’s tagline was “You Better Watch Out,” and Insider Gaming will tell you why.

All Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7 Loot Pool Changes

Alongside returning Xmas-themed POIs and a new OG Battle Pass, you can look forward to the Boom Box, Stink Bombs, a Scoped Revolver, and much more in Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7.

Here’s a quick summary of every item outed by Epic Games ahead of Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7 so far:

  • Balloons
  • Boom Box
  • Dual Pistols
  • Glider Redeploy
  • Infinity Blade (In-Season)
  • New Battle Pass
  • New POIs
    • Polar Peak
    • Happy Hamlet
    • Frosty Flights
  • New Skins
  • New Umbrella
  • Other Map Updates
  • Scoped AR
  • Scoped Revolver
  • Stink Bombs
  • Suppressed Sniper Rifle
  • X-4 Stormwing

Chapter 7’s storyline was a fairly new narrative more in keeping with the theme of Christmas. You too can experience this all for yourself when Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7 drops a few days from now.

Tell us about your favorite Chapter 1 Season 7 memories if you played the original content all those years ago. Where does it rank amongst the very best? The free-to-join Insider Gaming Discord Server is the perfect place to let it all out.

item.title: First Player to Escape from Tarkov Gets Unique ‘Streamer Item’
item.content:encoded:
Tigz, who was documented last week as being the first person in the world to successfully escape from Tarkov, has been awarded a unique streamer item by Battlestate Games. These items are used to represent the respect that Battlestate Games has for the content creators who pour their lives into pulling Escape from Tarkov into the limelight time and again.

There are dozens of streamer items in the game, but the latest one belongs to Tigz, and it’s a tongue-in-cheek reference to the failed runs that prevented him from getting out of Tarkov without too many issues.

Tigz Has a Streamer Item

Tigz has a unique streamer item that’s reminiscent of his time spent escaping through Terminal, the final map in Battlestate Games’ tough extraction shooter. In his first attempt, which was watched by tens of thousands of people, Tigz fell short of the ending after failing to find a splint to patch an injury that ultimately led to his death.

That forced him to try again, numerous times.

To honor and recognize that moment, Battlestate Games created a unique splint for Tigz’s streamer item – Tigzresq. It’s a 67-inch splint in a red and black design that may or may not be practical. Streamer items are rarely practical, but if any will have an honest, in-game use, it’s the Tigzresq.

Another streamer item with a practical use is Gingy’s keychain, which does what you’d imagine and holds keys. There’s also WillerZ’s wallet, the RatCola, sprats, and a jar of mayo, amongst other things.

Whenever someone becomes big for streaming Escape from Tarkov, their streamer item is never too far behind. Fans of TheBurntPeanut, who recently won awards at The Streamer Awards, are clamouring for a unique item in Escape from Tarkov, given the amount of time the VTuber (sorry, PTuber) has spent in the game in recent years.

If you had a streamer item in Escape from Tarkov, what would it be? Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Saros Has Been Rated in Taiwan, Pre-Orders Expected Imminently
item.content:encoded:
Saros rating has appeared in Taiwan for the title’s standard and deluxe editions, suggesting pre-orders are imminent.

Housemarque’s Saros is one of the most anticipated titles of 2026 and also the next PlayStation exclusive from the studio after Returnal. We have already seen some gameplay and have a release date for Saros as well; all players are waiting for now is for pre-orders to open.

Saros Rating Appears in Taiwan

Spotted by Gematsu on X (formerly Twitter), Saros’s standard and digital deluxe editions have been rated in Taiwan. Both versions have been rated ‘PG-15’ and contain violence and shooting according to the rating. Many players think that with the game’s rating surfacing now, a pre-order announcement could arrive soon; however, there is no official word from the developers. Interestingly, the rating has appeared very close to The Game Awards 2025, so could we expect an announcement there? Also, could Saros be the game behind the mysterious statue?

For those unaware, Saros is an upcoming sci-fi adventure that has players taking on the role of Arjun Devraj, a Soltari enforcer who will stop at nothing to pursue answers on the shape-shifting world of Carcosa. The title features a constantly evolving world, and you will need to find permanent resources to ensure it yields for you. It also features a high-tech arsenal of weapons, which has players dodging, shielding, and parrying enemy attacks in a “fluid, flow-state-inducing dance.”

In other news, check out Saros’s latest gameplay trailer, revealed during September’s State of Play event. Do you think Saros’ rating in Taiwan suggests pre-orders will start soon? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Paramount Reveals Hostile Offer for Warner Bros Worth $18 Billion More
item.content:encoded:
Last week, Netflix revealed an $82.7 billion deal to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery and carve out a monumental corner of the media streaming empire. Now, Paramount has clapped back with a hostile bid, slamming Netflix and claiming that it had offered an ‘inferior proposal’ for WBD.

Paramount’s representatives have promised a tender offer of $30 per share, compared to Netflix’s $27.75 offer. It’s also a bid to avoid splitting up Warner Bros. Discovery, which is what the Netflix acquisition would do. If Paramount is successful, it’ll acquire WBD in its entirety.

Will Paramount or Netflix Buy Warner Bros. Discovery?

In a post from The Hollywood Reporter, it was confirmed that Paramount had filed a hostile proposal in the wake of Netflix’s revelation in the WBD arena. In a statement, David Ellison, the CEO of Paramount, explained:

WBD shareholders deserve an opportunity to consider our superior all-cash offer for their shares in the entire company.

Our public offer, which is on the same terms we provided to the Warner Bros. Discovery Board of Directors in private, provides superior value, and a more certain and quicker path to completion. We believe the WBD Board of Directors is pursuing an inferior proposal which exposes shareholders to a mix of cash and stock, an uncertain future trading value of the Global Networks linear cable business and a challenging regulatory approval process.

We are taking our offer directly to shareholders to give them the opportunity to act in their own best interests and maximize the value of their shares.

The Hollywood Reporter anticipates a lengthy process to follow, with Paramount and Netflix lobbying and counter-lobbying for the acquisition rights of Warner Bros. Discovery.

In a strange twist, it was later revealed that Paramount published a website dubbed ‘StrongerHollywood’, aimed at rubbing Netflix the wrong way and proving that Paramount’s offer is much more worthwhile for the wider industry.

Whichever media titan is successful, they’ll gain ownership of Warner Bros.’ gaming studios, including the likes of Avalanche, NetherRealm, Rocksteady, and TT Games, as well as the WB Games branches.

item.title: Assassin’s Creed Games Will Feature More Parkour & Possibly ‘Dual-Protagonists’ Again
item.content:encoded:
A fascinating interview with Assassin’s Creed game director Simon Lemay-Comtois has revealed that the team is eager to learn from past mistakes and oversights for future Assassin’s Creed games, such as a lack of parkour focus.

Assassin’s Creed Shadows was a financial and critical success. It may not go down as peak AC, but it’s a solid return to form. Shadows, in particular, and its post-launch content are looking to bring back a classic gameplay tradition, and have spoken about the use of dual-player mechanics in additional releases down the line.

Future Assassin’s Creed Games Will Learn From Mistakes

An Insider Gaming exclusive revealed further details on the Assassin’s Creed Roadmap and what games to expect. There is clearly a long road ahead for the franchise, and Shadows was the latest mainline release.

Shadows game director Simon Lemay-Comtois told GamesRadar that the current release and future AC games should focus on one gameplay mechanic that’s been missing:

“Pay more attention to parkour in future games as its own pillar. We’re trying to rectify that in post-launch with Shadows and push that narrative internally to say, parkour matters. Let’s really push parkour forward.”

Old-school AC fans will remember scaling towns and cities across Italy, whereas recent games have placed less emphasis on verticality in favor of grander open-world design and combat.

There’s still an inherent desire for the basics of Assassin’s Creed roots. Speaking of which, another newer addition (opposing convention) in the last few years has been the incorporation of dual-player stories.

Lemay-Comtois has indicated that the system won’t be going away if it makes sense for the project:

“Dual protagonists can be divisive along very strange lines, right? It’s not just a ‘well, I prefer a war, therefore I prefer Yasuke.’ Some people just don’t like one character over the other, and they don’t like to spend time with one. It was true with Evie and Jacob, but with Naoe and Yasuke it’s more divisive. And we knew this. We knew going into it, but I think it can split our fan base a little too.

I think the learning for us is that, yes, we could do more dual-protagonist games in the future – if we have a good reason to do it narratively and for the setting.”

We know that the Assassin’s Creed IV: Black Flag Remake won’t be using two-player mechanics, and parkour will be very much part of its DNA. What do you want to see from future Assassin’s Creed games? Now’s your chance to tell the world through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

item.title: Final Fantasy 7 Remake Part 3’s Game Experience is ‘More or Less Complete’
item.content:encoded:
The director of Final Fantasy 7 Remake Part 3 has revealed a few new details about the upcoming title, with the game experience almost complete and the team narrowing down on a name.

Final Fantasy 7 Remake Part 3 is the next big instalment to the series, but the details about this game have been scarce, with players only knowing that the title already has “a lot” of playable content. Now, the developers have revealed even more details, including an important keyword to look out for in FF7 Remake Part 3.

Final Fantasy 7 Remake Part 3 Director Wants Players to Play the Game As Soon as Possible

During a new interview with Julien Chièze on YouTube (translated via Genki_JPN on X), Final Fantasy 7 Remake Part 3 director Naoki Hamaguchi revealed some new details about the title. Hamaguchi first stated that the game experience of Part 3 of the FF7 Remake Trilogy is more or less complete!” The team is now in the phase of “thoroughly developing it” and feels “very confident about it.” They are excited about players trying the game, but have to wait until the whole development process is complete. Square Enix is “almost at a point where they can share some more information.”

Naoki Hamaguchi revealed even more details about FF7 Remake Part 3 during the same interview. He first stated that he and Tetsuya Nomura are closing in on the name for the upcoming title, narrowing it down to only two options. The title should be decided within this year. Moreover, the director also stated that “Highwind” is an important keyword for Part 3 and doesn’t want the upcoming title to have the same experience as previous games. He wants to “deliver a new game experience and a new scale with part 3!”

In other news, Final Fantasy 7 Remake developers are considering a “full title” after part 3. Additionally, the size of FF7 Remake Intergrade is almost 100GB on the Switch 2. item.title: Hideo Kojima Doesn’t Know If OD ‘Will Work Out’
item.content:encoded:
Hideo Kojima recently spoke about his upcoming title, OD, stating that even he can’t say exactly what it is or whether it will work out.

The next Xbox Game Studios title by Hideo Kojima and Kojima Productions, OD, is already in the works, and we received a glimpse of the title earlier this year through its ‘Knock‘ trailer. We have also heard Kojima say that he wants to scan ‘real ghosts‘ for his upcoming title. Now, he has revealed more details on the challenges he is facing with OD.

Hideo Kojima Can’t Say What OD Exactly Is, But There Are Hints in the Trailer

During a new interview with Ananweb (via Automaton), Hideo Kojima spoke about the challenges he is facing while developing OD. He stated, “I can’t say exactly what it is yet, nor do I know if it will work out.” Kojima added that they have created stealth and delivery games “which were unlike anything before”. However, even those games had systems similar to other titles, which made the process a bit easier.

In the case of OD, Kojima and team are “trying to change the service model from the ground up,” which has proven to be “quite challenging.” At the same time, the recently released trailer is “full of hints,” so the highly passionate players might be able to figure it out if they spend enough time on it.

In other news, Insider Gaming’s exclusive report reveals that Eidos Montreal’s employees were working on OD before being asked to move to Japan. Additionally, the popular game director joined Zootopia 2’s cast just days before release.
